intro: Linaria parviracemosa, commonly known as the small racemed toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, such as open slopes and dry meadows. It has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Linaria parviracemosa is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial species.
